meanings.definition: A person who is irresponsible or unreliable.
meanings.sent1: Tommy is such a scattergood when it comes to finishing his homework on time.
meanings.sent2: Don't rely on Sarah to feed your pet, she's a scattergood and might forget.
meanings.sent3: The scattergood forgot his umbrella on a rainy day and ended up soaked.
meanings.sent4: Her scattergood behavior at work caused chaos among her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: Being a scattergood can lead to missed opportunities and disappointments.

meanings.sent1: The scattergood couldn't remember where he parked his car in the crowded parking lot.
meanings.sent2: She's a scattergood, always losing her keys and phone.
meanings.sent3: The scattergood accidentally put salt in his coffee instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: Her scattergood tendencies make her a lovable but forgetful friend.
meanings.sent5: Being a scattergood can be endearing but also frustrating for those around you.
